ccre.ctrl

Class FloatMixing

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.FloatMixing

  • public class FloatMixing
extends java.lang.Object
    FloatMixing is a class that provides a wide variety of useful static methods to accomplish various common actions primarily relating to float channels.
    Author:
    skeggsc
    See Also:
    BooleanMixing, EventMixing, Mixing

      • limit

        public static FloatFilter limit(float minimum,
                float maximum)
        Return a Filter that applies the specified limitation to the value.
        Parameters:
        minimum - The minimum value to limit to. Use Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY if you want no lower bound.
        maximum - The maximum value to limit to. Use Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY if you want no upper bound.
        Returns:
        The filter representing the specified limit.

                     EventInput updateWhen,
                     FloatOutput target)
        Add a ramping system that will wrap the specified FloatOutput in a ramping controller that will update when the specified event is produced, with the specified limit.
        Parameters:

        updateWhen - When to update the ramping system.
        target - The target to wrap.
        Returns:

        public static EventOutput createRamper(float limit,
                       FloatInputPoll from,
                       FloatOutput target)

        Parameters:
        limit - The maximum delta per update.
        from - The FloatInputPoll to control the expected value.
        target - The output to write the current value to.
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        in - the input
        out - the output

      • findRate

        public static FloatInputPoll findRate(FloatInputPoll input)
        Returns a FloatInputPoll representing the delta between the current value of input and the previous value. This _only_ works when you use the result in one place! If you use it in multiple, then it may try to find the deltas between each invocation! To get around this, use findRate with two arguments.
        Parameters:
        input - The input value to find the rate of.
        Returns:
        The FloatInputPoll representing the rate.

      • findRate

        public static FloatInputPoll findRate(FloatInputPoll input,
                      EventInput updateWhen)
        Returns a FloatInputPoll representing the delta between the current value of input and the value in the last cycle, denoted by the specified EventInput. If you only need to use this in one place, then using findRate with one argument might be a better choice.
        Parameters:
        input - The input value to find the rate of.
        updateWhen - When to update the current state, so that the delta is from the last update of this.
        Returns:
        The FloatInputPoll representing the rate.

      • normalizeFloat

        public static FloatInputPoll normalizeFloat(FloatInputPoll base,
                            float zero,
                            float one)
        Returns a scaled version of the specified input, such that when the value from the specified input is the value in the one parameter, the output is 1.0, and when the value from the specified input is the value in the zero parameter, the output is 0.0. The value is linearly scaled, for example: a value of ((zero + one) / 2) will create an output of 0.5. There is no capping - the output can be any number, including a number out of the range of zero to one. The scaling is equivalent to: (base.get() - zero) / (one - zero)
        Parameters:
        base - the value to scale.
        zero - the value of base that turns into 0.0.
        one - the value of base that turns into 1.0.
        Returns:
        the scaled value.

      • normalizeFloat

        public static FloatInputPoll normalizeFloat(FloatInputPoll base,
                            FloatInputPoll zero,
                            FloatInputPoll one)
        Returns a scaled version of the specified input, such that when the value from the specified input is the value in the one parameter, the output is 1.0, and when the value from the specified input is the value in the zero parameter, the output is 0.0. The value is linearly scaled, for example: a value of ((zero + one) / 2) will create an output of 0.5. There is no capping - the output can be any number, including a number out of the range of zero to one. The scaling is equivalent to: (base.get() - zero.get()) / (one.get() - zero.get())
        Parameters:
        base - the value to scale.
        zero - the value of base that turns into 0.0.
        one - the value of base that turns into 1.0.
        Returns:
        the scaled value.

      • onUpdate

        public static EventInput onUpdate(FloatInput input)
        Get an EventInput that updates whenever the input changes.
        Parameters:
        input - the input to track.
        Returns:
        an input for when the given input changes.

            EventOutput output)

        Parameters:
        input - the input to track
        output - the output to fire
